alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Cobb; DeKalb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; North Fulton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 12:23AM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cherokee, northwestern DeKalb, southwestern Forsyth, northeastern Cobb, west central Gwinnett and northeastern Fulton Counties through 115 AM EDT... At 1223 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Dunwoody, or 9 miles southeast of Mountain Park, moving west at 30 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Marietta, Mountain Park, Sandy Springs, Roswell, Johns Creek, Alpharetta, Dunwoody, Kennesaw, Duluth, Woodstock, Suwanee, Lilburn, Chamblee, Holly Springs, Norcross, Doraville, Berkeley Lake, Fair Oaks, Tucker and North Atlanta. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.

area.areaDesc: Cherokee; Cobb; DeKalb; Forsyth; Gwinnett; North Fulton
